statements: UPDATE MonthlyFinancialReports SET total_expenses = 5000.00, net_income = 10000.00 WHERE report_id = 1;
UPDATE MonthlyFinancialReports SET total_revenue = 15000.00, net_income = total_revenue - total_expenses WHERE month = 'January' AND year = 2022;
UPDATE MonthlyFinancialReports SET total_revenue = 5000.50, total_expenses = 3000.25, net_income = 2000.25 WHERE report_id = 101;
UPDATE MonthlyFinancialReports SET month = 'October', total_revenue = 6000.75, year = 2021, net_income = 3000.50 WHERE report_id = 102;
UPDATE financial_reports SET total_income = 50000.00, total_expenses = 20000.00 WHERE report_id = 101
UPDATE expense_categories SET category_description = 'Operating expenses' WHERE category_id = 1
UPDATE financial_reports SET total_income = 5000.50, total_expenses = 2500.75 WHERE report_id = 101
UPDATE expense_categories SET category_description = 'New description' WHERE category_name = 'Travel'
UPDATE financial_reports SET total_revenue = 50000.00, total_expenses = 30000.00 WHERE report_id = 1;
UPDATE expense_details SET amount = 10000.00 WHERE report_id = 2 AND category = 'Office Supplies';
UPDATE financial_reports SET total_revenue = 5000.00, total_expenses = 3000.00 WHERE report_id = 1;
UPDATE revenue_details SET category = 'Consulting', amount = 1500.00 WHERE report_id = 1;
UPDATE financial_reports SET total_revenue = total_revenue + 1000 WHERE report_id = 1;
UPDATE transactions SET status = 'Completed' WHERE transaction_id = 100;
UPDATE financial_reports SET total_amount = total_amount + 1000 WHERE report_id = 12345;
UPDATE transactions SET status = 'approved', amount = 500 WHERE transaction_id = 98765;
UPDATE MonthlyReports SET total_income = 5000.00, total_expenses = 3000.00 WHERE report_id = 1;
UPDATE EmployeeSalaries SET salary = 60000.00, department = 'IT' WHERE employee_id = 101;
UPDATE MonthlyReports SET total_income = total_income + 5000, total_expenses = total_expenses - 200 WHERE report_id = 100
UPDATE IncomeDetails SET amount = amount * 1.1 WHERE category = 'Bonus'
